a.h1: Watertown School District Enabling All Students to Succeed in an Ever-Changing World

div.div: This search form uses an instant search feature. As you type, search results will appear automatically below the search field. When you've entered you desired search terms use tab to navigate through the available results and hit enter to open the selected page or document.

div.style: border: solid 1px #F9C632; padding: 8px 10px; border-radius: 12px; display: inline-block; background: rgba(80,35,113,1.0); margin-left: 5px;

div.p: On January 24, the Watertown School District employees recognized the nominees and winners for the 2020-2021 Classified and Certified Staff of the Year. Congratulations to...
Pay for your students meals through Meal Time at no charge to you! Food service deposits will no longer be charged a processing fee for paying online. Save time, ...

p.a: Event: Last Day of Virtual Learning for 2019-2020

div.p: From the Watertown School District: Materials Exchange will take place on Mon., April 20 from 8-5 at all buildings. The final day of school for students will be Thurs. May 21. The PACH program will no longer have a separate distribution and will instead be included in the Community Food Distribution held at the Boys & Girls Club on Thursdays at 4:00 PM. More information coming soon on graduation. Have a great weekend.

From the Watertown School District: No school or lunches served on Fri. April 10 and Mon. April 13. We will continue with flex learning on Tues. April 14. Our next materials exchange will be on Mon. April 20. Thanks for your continued help with all of our school needs. One tip to keep in mind is to remember to login to the filter each day on the school device. Enjoy the long weekend.

From the Watertown School District: The Governor has now closed schools for the remainder of the 19-20 school year. We will remain in our flexible learning environment and follow the approved calendar to finish this school year. All activities have now been canceled for the year as well. We are working on plans to still celebrate our graduating seniors and will let people know as soon as we have those plans formalized. Thank you again for supporting us in this unusual set of circumstances.

To: Watertown School District Families: Please know we are thinking of you these days. We appreciate all the help you have given us to keep education rolling. Please take a look at this link with a letter for an update on things going on at school. We are having another materials exchange on Monday, April 6 from 8-5 at all buildings. Have a great weekend! https://5il.co/emum

From the Watertown School District: Thanks again for your assistance on Monday with our materials distribution. Everyone's cooperation has been so good to see. Beginning on Monday, March 31, all schools will be available from 8 AM to 5 PM for homework turn in and materials exchange. We will do this each Monday, and this will be determined and communicated via buildings. I want to emphasize again the availability of a free lunch each weekday from 11:30-12:30 at all 5 elementary schools and the intermediate school. This is for any student ages 3-18 still enrolled at Watertown. Thank you for your help with homework, as we're all trying to make the best of the situation. Have a great weekend.

Watertown School District

Watertown, SD 57201
